page.title: 10MOLES FARM.
page.content: One of the the largest farms in the Rib valley is {"MOLES' FARM"}. The farm covers 550 acres. Most of this is used for growing wheat,barley,potatoes field beans,oats and oil-seed rape. Some of the land is used to graze the 200 or so sheep that the farmer owns. The farm does not make its own silage but does grow its own hay for feeding the sheep in winter. The farm is owned by a lady,but it is farmed for her,in partnership,by a manager and 3 full time workers. Getting water at the farm is a problem,as it is over 100 feet above the river. There is a small water tower,which is about 70 feet up to the platform. It has a bore hole of more than 300 feet deep. The tower stores water and supplies some of the nearby houses of Thundridge,as well as the farm itself. There are 3 ponds around the farm buildings as well.
